The next few days flew by in a hurry.%K%P
In addition to the Goddesses' plans, the normal\nfestival prep was making good progress.%K%P
This was just the same stuff we did every year, so\nit really wasn't much of a hassle.%K%P
I did get worked to exhaustion as the only young\nhand around, but that was also something that\nhappened every year.%K%P
\dAki, look! Things are really taking off online!\d%K%P
\dYeah...? Oh, yeah, that's really something.\d%K%P
\dI'm good at inciting the masses.\d%K%P
I'm not sure 'inciting' them is really our goal...%K%P
\dI'll admit it, that is a good web page.\d%K%P
It was a rare day when Yukari complimented a rival.%K%P
But Shion's professional-quality work was good\nenough to merit even that.%K%P
\dIt's crazy to think you didn't have an official\nsite for this already. Not even any social network\naccounts.\d%K%P
\dWell, you've seen the age group we cater to here.\d%K%P
It would be nice if city workers came out to help\nus, but all the aid tended to flow to the main\nshrine.%K%P
\dI'm not all up to speed on this sort of stuff, but\nI take it Shion's doing a good job?\d%K%P
\dYou're not really tech savvy. That's why you\nshould just leave this stuff up to me.\d%K%P
\dI'll happily do just that.\d%K%P
Kaede hadn't yet joined us in the digital age. She\nwas about as far removed from the net as you could\nbe these days.%K%P
That's why she left all the promotional business in\nShion's hands.%K%P
\dDon't go overboard though, Shion.\d%K%P
\dAw, come on, you're supposed to hype things up a\nlittle online.\d%K%P
Shion's campaign had gone so viral that even she\nrealized it was a little excessive.%K%P
She didn't stop at promoting the festival, but went\non to include the shrine itself and the nearby\narea.%K%P
No matter what her intentions were, this was going\nto be good for the people around here.%K%P
\dHow are things on your end, Kaede? Making\nprogress?\d%K%P
\dOf course. I've got the local ladies helping me\ncook, so it should be fine.\d%K%P
\dThe stamp cards are ready to go, too. With\nextravagant prizes, to boot!\d%K%P
\dSounds like it's all coming together.\d%K%P
None of us knew what Yukari was planning, though.%K%P
She'd been spending her days the same as always,\ndoing nothing out of the ordinary.%K%P
\dWhat trickery are you planning...?\d%K%P
\dEheheh, I could never let the competition in on my\nstrategy.\d%K%P
\dI guess that means you're up to something.\d%K%P
\dAnd here we are sharing all our plans. Think that\nputs us at a disadvantage?\d%K%P
\dYou'll just have to wait and see!\d%K%P
Yukari smiled and didn't spill a single detail.%K%P
Unable to draw any info out of her, Kaede and\nShion looked worried.%K%P
Before long it was the night before the festival.%K%P
The excitement made it hard to sleep.%K%P
\dTonight's prep is done already...\d%K%P
A few stalls already had been set up by the torii\ngate.%K%P
They were on sacred grounds of course, so they\nweren't there to turn a profit.%K%P
\dTomorrow's the day, huh... I wonder how it'll go.\d%K%P
No matter who won, it would be cause for\ncelebration.%K%P
Everyone had worked hard to put this together.%K%P
But me...what could I do?%K%P
\dLooks like everyone's still awake.\d%K%P
The lights still weren't out.%K%P
Maybe they were still busy with last minute prep.\nOr maybe they were just like me and couldn't sleep.%K%P
\dMaybe I should go check on her...\d%K
